DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Interface Web para a Ferramenta Mininet como Suporte para a Experimentação com o OpenFlow
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Mininet Web Interface supporting OpenFlow Experimentation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Cadernos Técnicos de Computação e Energia
DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.ORGANIZADORES: Sérgio Martins Fernandes; Romildo Martins Da Silva Bezerra

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In recent years, the paradigm of Software Defined Networking for has been extensively studied, especially in academia. One of the basic principles of this latest technology is the separation of data plans and control through specific protocols like OpenFlow. As a result many people have opted to use the emulator Mininet network which allows defining and experimenting with the OpenFlow protocol to develop new applications, projects and systems. One of the particularities Mininet is that it is a bit ergonométrica tool that requires relatively complex setup and adjustments when performed manually. This paper presents a web interface, which is designed to make the interaction between the user and Mininet more friendly compared with the direct interface with the tool.

One of the particularities Mininet is that it is a bit ergonométrica tool that requires relatively complex setup and adjustments when performed manually. This paper presents a web interface, which is designed to make the interaction between the user and Mininet more friendly compared with the direct interface with the tool.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Information Management in Fab Labs: Avoiding Information and Communication Overload in Digital Manufacturing

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Advances in Information Quality and Management
DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.ORGANIZADORES: Rui Pedro Figueiredo Marques;João Carlos Lopes Batista

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Information is managed avoiding overload in Fab Labs, digital manufacturing environments. Collaborative spaces like Maker Spaces, Hacker Spaces, Tech Shops and Fab Labs are intended to stimulate innovation, through the exchange and sharing of information, knowledge, and experience among its members. They leverage innovation stimulating the creativity of its participants and enabling the creation of products and solutions based on personal projects, developed communally. With the motto ?Learn, Make, Share,? these spaces aim to empower its members for the realization of local and community-based sustainable solutions, using open source tools and equipment's, to allow every member the possibility of creating low cost products, with the ability to very quickly show the viability of these ideas through the acceptance by the community, that will make these solutions evolve collaboratively. It will be analyzed and described how Fab Labs manage their information to avoid information overload, maximizing the networking amongst its members.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Information is managed avoiding overload in Fab Labs, digital manufacturing environments. Collaborative spaces like Maker Spaces, Hacker Spaces, Tech Shops and Fab Labs are intended to stimulate innovation, through the exchange and sharing of information, knowledge, and experience among its members. They leverage innovation stimulating the creativity of its participants and enabling the creation of products and solutions based on personal projects, developed communally. With the motto ?Learn, Make, Share,? these spaces aim to empower its members for the realization of local and community-based sustainable solutions, using open source tools and equipment's, to allow every member the possibility of creating low cost products, with the ability to very quickly show the viability of these ideas through the acceptance by the community, that will make these solutions evolve collaboratively. It will be analyzed and described how Fab Labs manage their information to avoid information overload, maximizing the networking amongst its members.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: An Integrated Pedagogical Approach for Distance Learning Courses: Curriculum, ICT and Management

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Education for the 21st Century Impact of ICT and Digital Resources

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Distance learning courses need intensive planning that, in turn, requires the integration of knowledge and expertise in different areas and levels such as curriculum, ICTs and course management. This paper presents an integrated approach for distance learning course planning that derives from pedagogical research the basic directives to integrate the process variables such as curriculum, ICT options and management. It is argued that distance learning projects always have some research activity involved, since the operation model construction always requires the identification of course characteristics and specificities in order to face the challenges imposed by this teaching method and take advantage of ICT technologies in a specific socio-economical context. In practical terms, course implementation is focused on pedagogical-driven decisions based on a flexible curriculum model suitable for different implementation scenarios and course characteristics. The integrated approach has been used in various high capillary courses (humanities, mathematics, others) with limited ICT resources.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A collaborative space for stimulating creativity is a place of learning through the exchange and sharing of knowledge and experience among its members. It allows to leverage innovation through the use of technological resources available in the space, stimulating the creativity of its participants, enabling the development of products and solutions based on personal projects ? Do It Yourself (DIY) - from ideation, or the construction supported on knowledge developed by other elements together, collaboratively, enhancing the final result ? Do It With Others (DIWO). A research project is being held to create a new Lab, or transform and adapt one of the existing Lab?s, in a Fab Lab or a Maker Space to let students, teachers and staff give wings to their imagination and develop innovative solutions to solve real problems, while they interact and exchange tacit knowledge, making it explicit after concluding their projects when they share their research reports.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.AMBIENTE: Ferramenta de apoio|Aplicativos desenvolv. sist. de acordo com determ. metodologia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nos últimos anos, o paradigma das Redes Definidas por Software tem sido amplamente estudado, principalmente no meio acadêmico. Um dos princípios básicos dessa recente tecnologia é a separação dos planos de dados e de controle, através de protocolos específicos como o OpenFlow. Em consequência muitas pessoas optaram por utilizar o emulador de rede Mininet o qual permite a definição e experimentação com o protocolo OpenFlow, para desenvolver novas aplicações, projetos e sistemas. Uma das particularidades do Mininet é que ele é uma ferramenta pouco ergonométrica que requer ajustes relativamente complexos quando a configuração e realizada manualmente. Este artigo apresenta uma interface web, que foi desenvolvida para tornar a interação entre o usuário e o Mininet mais amigável em relação com a interface direta com a ferramenta
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nos últimos anos, o paradigma das Redes Definidas por Software tem sido amplamente estudado, principalmente no meio acadêmico. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This standard appears in: IEEE Std 1003.0-1995 Publication Date: 29 Dec. 1995 E-ISBN: 0-7381-3138-5 Number of Pages: xii+261
This guide presents an overview of open system concepts and their applications. Information is provided to persons evaluating systems based on the existence of, and interrelationships among, application software standards, with the objective of enabling application portability and system interoperability. A framework is presented that identifies key information system interfaces involved in application probability and system interoperability and describes the services offered across these interfaces. Standards or standards activities associated with the services are identified where they exist or are in progress. Gaps are identified where POSIX Open System Environment services are not currently being addressed by formal standards. Finally, the concept of a profile is discussed with examples from several application domains.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Outras Atividades de Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Esta assessoria executada junto à Universidade Salvador ? UNIFACS refere-se à produção de trabalho de indicação de direções e metas prospectivas para o Parque Tecnológico da Cidade de Salvador.
No documento desenvolvido são apresentadas as direções propostas para a área de Tecnologia da Informação do Parque Tecnológico, resultado do trabalho de assessoria.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-4: Tecnologias de Rede de Alta Velocidade

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Palestra 4 - Redes e telecomunicações Prof. Joberto S. B. Martins Esta palestra aborda inicialmente a tendência de integração entre as áreas de telecomunicações e redes, comumente denominada de "convergência". Em seguida, discorre-se sobre a evolução das redes de computadores em particular, identificando alguns aspectos essenciais para o suporte à convergência "Redes & Telecom" e, também, essenciais para a disseminação na utilização das redes como suporte de comunicação. Neste contexto, são discutidas as evoluções mais importantes das tecnologias de rede como, por exemplo, as redes ópticas, as soluções visando o suporte à qualidade de serviço (QoS), as aplicações multimídia em rede e os novos protocolos de suporte às redes multiserviço. De maneira geral, são discutidos alguns dos aspectos técnicos mais relevantes no contexto da integração de redes com as telecomunicações, tentando-se indicar as tendências em desenvolvimento, pesquisa e produtos. Em termos técnicos, a palestra procura articular tópicos como WDM, Gigabit Ethernet, DiffServ, MPLS, VoIP, SIP, MGCP e IPv6 no sentido de viabilizar a massificação na utilização das redes de computadores e, em particular, das redes IP

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Smart Grid e IEC 61850: Novos Desaﬁos em Redes e Telecomunicações para o Sistema Elétrico
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Smart Grid and IEC 61850: New Challenges in Networks and Telecommunications for the Electric System

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpósio Brasileiro de Telecomunicações - SBrT 2012

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Planejamento, Projeto e Controle de Sistemas de Produção

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Smart Grid is an innovating solution for the electrical systems that consists in an integrated architecture for all system components, including generation, transmission, distribution, and users. This architecture is strongly based on telecommunications networks with potential and inherent advantages such as greater overall efficiency and system-wide reliability, providing communication among intelligent devices. This short-course explains the main smart grid concepts and challenges and explores the IEC 61850 standard which, in turn, standardizes the communications among devices. The IEC 61850 and other relevant protocols are the basic building blocks of a communication network in a smart grid style. The challenges discussed include a new generation of telecommunications network for the smart grid together with security, management, control, quality of service, and migration issues.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Smart Grid is an innovating solution for the electrical systems that consists in an integrated architecture for all system components, including generation, transmission, distribution, and users. This architecture is strongly based on telecommunications networks with potential and inherent advantages such as greater overall efficiency and system-wide reliability, providing communication among intelligent devices. This short-course explains the main smart grid concepts and challenges and explores the IEC 61850 standard which, in turn, standardizes the communications among devices. The IEC 61850 and other relevant protocols are the basic building blocks of a communication network in a smart grid style. The challenges discussed include a new generation of telecommunications network for the smart grid together with security, management, control, quality of service, and migration issues.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Future Internet Research Trends

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: LAUREATE WEBINAR Series

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The webinar intends to describe internet and networks in general which are evolving dramatically and, in fact, are essential parts of our daily live. The scope of Internet applications is currently far beyond the initially previewed by Internet/TCP/IP designers. Actual research and development challenges consist in either adapting or clean slating Internet network design in order to allow networks to support mobile users, massive video distribution with high quality, smart cities, e-health and social networking application among many others possible areas and future applications. This webinar, in brief, points to new applications and current research trends in networking towards this (re)evolutionary future.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The webinar intends to describe internet and networks in general which are evolving dramatically and, in fact, are essential parts of our daily live. The scope of Internet applications is currently far beyond the initially previewed by Internet/TCP/IP designers. Actual research and development challenges consist in either adapting or clean slating Internet network design in order to allow networks to support mobile users, massive video distribution with high quality, smart cities, e-health and social networking application among many others possible areas and future applications. This webinar, in brief, points to new applications and current research trends in networking towards this (re)evolutionary future.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: An iRODS-based Distributed and Federated Data Repository for a Multi-CMF Network for Experimentation
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: An iRODS-based Distributed and Federated Data Repository for a Multi-CMF Network for Experimentation

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 8th Latin American Network Operations and Management Symposium - LANOMS 2015

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Network for Experimentation (NfExp) is, typically, a large (regional, national or international) and specialized testbed (GENI, PlanetLab, FIBRE, other) developed in order to support the experimentation of new protocols, services and applications mostly in the context of Future Internet (FI). In effect, a Network for Experimentation allows an experimenter to configure instantiate, run and collect measurements of distributed experiments on top of a testbed managed by a Control and Monitoring Framework (CMF). Recent Network for Experimentation deployments are Multi-CMF testbeds in which various existing CMFs are integrated in order to achieve a larger set of supported applications and services. This paper describes a distributed and federated storage solution for monitoring data in a Multi-CMF scenario (FIBRE testbed). The solution adopts a distributed iRODS-based monitoring data storage scheme, supporting data distribution and federation across islands (institutions) implementing the testbed. A distributed and transparent data storage facility among multiple native database systems was implemented supporting real-time and persistent monitoring data storage. It allows federated seamless monitoring data storage/retrieval for FIBRE data integration.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A Network for Experimentation (NfExp) is, typically, a large (regional, national or international) and specialized testbed (GENI, PlanetLab, FIBRE, other) developed in order to support the experimentation of new protocols, services and applications mostly in the context of Future Internet (FI). In effect, a Network for Experimentation allows an experimenter to configure instantiate, run and collect measurements of distributed experiments on top of a testbed managed by a Control and Monitoring Framework (CMF). Recent Network for Experimentation deployments are Multi-CMF testbeds in which various existing CMFs are integrated in order to achieve a larger set of supported applications and services. This paper describes a distributed and federated storage solution for monitoring data in a Multi-CMF scenario (FIBRE testbed). The solution adopts a distributed iRODS-based monitoring data storage scheme, supporting data distribution and federation across islands (institutions) implementing the testbed. A distributed and transparent data storage facility among multiple native database systems was implemented supporting real-time and persistent monitoring data storage. It allows federated seamless monitoring data storage/retrieval for FIBRE data integration.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Innovation in Future Internet Scenario with Network Programmability and Smart Systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Innovation in Future Internet Scenario with Network Programmability and Smart Systems

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: CAMPUS PARTY BA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Internet is always evolving and has a Strong presence in our Society. In parallel, ?Innovation? has become a decisive factor when creating, developing or researching new systems and applications. This talk points and discusses, with a simultaneous technical and strategic approach, how to aggregate innovation in the context of actual Internet evolution towards the Future Internet (FI). The adoption of OpenFlow/SDN with an autonomic approach is suggested as one possible way to innovate.

In parallel, ?Innovation? has become a decisive factor when creating, developing or researching new systems and applications. This talk points and discusses, with a simultaneous technical and strategic approach, how to aggregate innovation in the context of actual Internet evolution towards the Future Internet (FI). The adoption of OpenFlow/SDN with an autonomic approach is suggested as one possible way to innovate.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Evaluating CBR Similarity Functions for BAM Switching in Networks with Dynamic Traffic Profile
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Evaluating CBR Similarity Functions for BAM Switching in Networks with Dynamic Traffic Profile

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 5th International Workshop on ADVANCEs in ICT Infrastructures and Services

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In an increasingly complex scenario for network management, a solution that allows configuration in more autonomous way with less intervention of the network manager is expected. This paper presents an evaluation of similarity functions that are necessary in the context of using a learning strategy for finding solutions. The learning approach considered is based on Case-Based Reasoning (CBR) and is applied to a network scenario where different Bandwidth Allocation Models (BAMs) behaviors are used and must be eventually switched looking for the best possible network operation. In this context, it is required to identify and configure an adequate similarity function that will be used in the learning process to recover similar solutions previously considered. This paper introduces the similarity functions, explains the relevant aspects of the learning process in which the similarity function plays a role and, finally, presents a proof of concept for a specific similarity function adopted. Results show that the similarity function was capable to get similar results from the existing use case database. As such, the use of similarity functions with CBR technique has proved to be potentially satisfactory for supporting BAM switching decisions mostly driven by the dynamics of input traffic profile.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In an increasingly complex scenario for network management, a solution that allows configuration in more autonomous way with less intervention of the network manager is expected. This paper presents an evaluation of similarity functions that are necessary in the context of using a learning strategy for finding solutions. The learning approach considered is based on Case-Based Reasoning (CBR) and is applied to a network scenario where different Bandwidth Allocation Models (BAMs) behaviors are used and must be eventually switched looking for the best possible network operation. In this context, it is required to identify and configure an adequate similarity function that will be used in the learning process to recover similar solutions previously considered. This paper introduces the similarity functions, explains the relevant aspects of the learning process in which the similarity function plays a role and, finally, presents a proof of concept for a specific similarity function adopted. Results show that the similarity function was capable to get similar results from the existing use case database. As such, the use of similarity functions with CBR technique has proved to be potentially satisfactory for supporting BAM switching decisions mostly driven by the dynamics of input traffic profile.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: On Evaluating Power Loss with HATSGA Algorithm for Power Network Reconfiguration in the Smart Grid
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: On Evaluating Power Loss with HATSGA Algorithm for Power Network Reconfiguration in the Smart Grid

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 5th International Workshop on ADVANCEs in ICT Infrastructures and Services

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents the power network reconfiguration algorithm HATSGA with a ?R? modeling approach and evaluates its behavior in computing new reconfiguration topologies for the power network in the Smart Grid context. The modelling of the power distribution network with the language ?R? is used to represent the network and support computation of distinct algorithm configurations towards the evaluation of new reconfiguration topologies. The HATSGA algorithm adopts hybrid Tabu Search and Genetic Algorithm strategy and can be configured in different ways to compute network reconfiguration solutions. The evaluation of power loss with HATSGA uses the IEEE 14-Bus topology as the power test scenario. The evaluation of reconfiguration topologies with minimum power loss with HATSGA indicates that an efficient solution can be reached with a feasible computational time. This suggests that HATSGA can be potentially used for computing reconfiguration network topologies and, beyond that, it can be used for autonomic self-healing management approaches where a feasible computational time is required.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents the power network reconfiguration algorithm HATSGA with a ?R? modeling approach and evaluates its behavior in computing new reconfiguration topologies for the power network in the Smart Grid context. The modelling of the power distribution network with the language ?R? is used to represent the network and support computation of distinct algorithm configurations towards the evaluation of new reconfiguration topologies. The HATSGA algorithm adopts hybrid Tabu Search and Genetic Algorithm strategy and can be configured in different ways to compute network reconfiguration solutions. The evaluation of power loss with HATSGA uses the IEEE 14-Bus topology as the power test scenario. The evaluation of reconfiguration topologies with minimum power loss with HATSGA indicates that an efficient solution can be reached with a feasible computational time. This suggests that HATSGA can be potentially used for computing reconfiguration network topologies and, beyond that, it can be used for autonomic self-healing management approaches where a feasible computational time is required.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: A SDN-based Flexible System for On-the-Fly Monitoring and Treatment of Security Events
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: A SDN-based Flexible System for On-the-Fly Monitoring and Treatment of Security Events

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 5th International Workshop on ADVANCEs in ICT Infrastructures and Services

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Software Defined Networking (SDN) paradigm decouples control and data planes, offering high programmability and a global view of the network. However, it is a challenge not only provide security in these next generation networks as well as allow that network attacks could be subjected to an incident and forensic treatment procedure. This paper proposes the implementation of flexible mechanisms of monitoring and treatment of security events categorized per type of attack and associated with whitelist and blacklist resources by means of the SDN controller programmability. The resources to perform intrusion and attack analysis are validated by means of a real SDN/OpenFlow testbed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Software Defined Networking (SDN) paradigm decouples control and data planes, offering high programmability and a global view of the network. However, it is a challenge not only provide security in these next generation networks as well as allow that network attacks could be subjected to an incident and forensic treatment procedure. This paper proposes the implementation of flexible mechanisms of monitoring and treatment of security events categorized per type of attack and associated with whitelist and blacklist resources by means of the SDN controller programmability. The resources to perform intrusion and attack analysis are validated by means of a real SDN/OpenFlow testbed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO: Future Internet and Software Defined Networking
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-IN.TITULO-INGLES: Future Internet and Software Defined Networking

DETALHAMENTO-DO-MATERIAL-DIDATICO-OU-INS.FINALIDADE: Master and PhD course on Future Internet and Software Defined Networking technologies.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In technical terms, the course will first explore the Future Internet perspective and the Software Defined Network (SDN) approach for network development and research. Considering this scenario, the OpenFlow protocol (OF) approach will be adopted to demonstrate the viability and great potential of extensively used concepts like virtualization and Networks for Experimentation (NfE). In terms of the Networks for Experimentation (NfE), the course will present, discuss and exercise some of the adopted and researched approaches such as OFELIA (OpenFlow in Europe: Linking Infrastructure and Applications) - focus on OpenFlow, OMF/OML (Orbit Management Framework) ? basic focus on wireless, ProtoGENI and FIBRE EU-BR (Future Internet Testbed Experimentation between Brazil and Europe) - focus on integrating OFELIA, OMF and ProtoGeni on an intercontinental scale.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In technical terms, the course will first explore the Future Internet perspective and the Software Defined Network (SDN) approach for network development and research. Considering this scenario, the OpenFlow protocol (OF) approach will be adopted to demonstrate the viability and great potential of extensively used concepts like virtualization and Networks for Experimentation (NfE). In terms of the Networks for Experimentation (NfE), the course will present, discuss and exercise some of the adopted and researched approaches such as OFELIA (OpenFlow in Europe: Linking Infrastructure and Applications) - focus on OpenFlow, OMF/OML (Orbit Management Framework) ? basic focus on wireless, ProtoGENI and FIBRE EU-BR (Future Internet Testbed Experimentation between Brazil and Europe) - focus on integrating OFELIA, OMF and ProtoGeni on an intercontinental scale.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: La Reunión Regional es un evento que se realiza a cada año, los participantes son los miembros del Comité Regional de la R9 que en sí se refiere a la unión de: Presidentes de Sección, Presidentes de Consejo, Presidentes de Comités Regulares y Miembros del Comité Ejecutivo, todos ellos con derecho a voto en las decisiones a tomar. En esta reunión se fijan las líneas de la región 9 en beneficio de todos los miembros (estudiantes y profesionales) y de la sociedad, lo cual impacta positivamente en el desarrollo de la región, y afianza los vínculos entre los paises de Latinoamérica y el Caribe.

En esta reunión se fijan las líneas de la región 9 en beneficio de todos los miembros (estudiantes y profesionales) y de la sociedad, lo cual impacta positivamente en el desarrollo de la región, y afianza los vínculos entre los paises de Latinoamérica y el Caribe.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Atividades dos serviços de tecnologia da informação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O 3º Fórum de Tecnologias aborda de forma clara e objetiva as tecnologias que estão cada vez mais presentes nos nossos negócios e, ao mesmo tempo, indica os desafios decorrentes da utilização destas no mundo dos negócios e no cotidiano das pessoas. Em efeito, a sociedade da informação está num processo contínuo e crescente de inclusão de soluções tecnológicas que, via de regra, facilitam a vida dos consumidores e propiciam uma variedade de novos negócios e serviços. Este é um evento moldado nas necessidades da sociedade da informação e na sociedade como um todo que tem como objetivo principal a indicação de alternativas de negócios e serviços de maneira geral. As temáticas discutidas são abrangentes em relação à Tecnologia da Informação e Engenharias de maneira geral.

Em efeito, a sociedade da informação está num processo contínuo e crescente de inclusão de soluções tecnológicas que, via de regra, facilitam a vida dos consumidores e propiciam uma variedade de novos negócios e serviços. As temáticas discutidas são abrangentes em relação à Tecnologia da Informação e Engenharias de maneira geral.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of the Workshop is to bring together the academic community and industrial partners interested in Future Internet topics and show the first results of FIBRE, which experimental network (testbed) is scheduled to be operational in early 2013. Funded by the Brazilian government and the European Commission under the FP7 programme, the project was conceived to design, implement and validate a shared infrastructure for Future Internet experimentation for European and Brazilian researchers.

Funded by the Brazilian government and the European Commission under the FP7 programme, the project was conceived to design, implement and validate a shared infrastructure for Future Internet experimentation for European and Brazilian researchers.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Smart Grid is an innovating solution for the electrical systems that consists in an integrated architecture for all system components, including generation, transmission, distribution, and users. This architecture is strongly based on IT and telecommunications networks with potential and inherent advantages such as greater overall efficiency and system-wide reliability, providing communication among intelligent devices. This event explores the main smart grid concepts and challenges and explores the IEC 61850 standard which, in turn, standardizes the communications among devices. The challenges discussed include the Smart Grid best practices, architecture, influence in in the energy matrix, the new generation of telecommunications network for the smart grid together with security, management, control, quality of service, and migration issues.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Smart Grid is an innovating solution for the electrical systems that consists in an integrated architecture for all system components, including generation, transmission, distribution, and users. This architecture is strongly based on IT and telecommunications networks with potential and inherent advantages such as greater overall efficiency and system-wide reliability, providing communication among intelligent devices. This event explores the main smart grid concepts and challenges and explores the IEC 61850 standard which, in turn, standardizes the communications among devices. The challenges discussed include the Smart Grid best practices, architecture, influence in in the energy matrix, the new generation of telecommunications network for the smart grid together with security, management, control, quality of service, and migration issues.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ICT technologies and new network infrastructures and services are changing drastically our society in all areas of applications. The advances in communication networks and computing infrastructure have not only an impact on the way people are working but also on the way they are interacting, learning, educating and so on. How these technologies do respond to the societal needs and how they should evolve to respond to future needs of the society are crucial aspects to discuss. After the successful organization of the ADVANCE workshop in 2012 in Canoa Quebrada (Brazil), this 2nd edition of the workshop aims to continue to bring together practitioners and researchers from both academia and industry in order to have a forum for discussion and technical presentations on latest theoretical and technological advances. https://lrsm.ibisc.univ-evry.fr/ADVANCE2013/

How these technologies do respond to the societal needs and how they should evolve to respond to future needs of the society are crucial aspects to discuss. After the successful organization of the ADVANCE workshop in 2012 in Canoa Quebrada (Brazil), this 2nd edition of the workshop aims to continue to bring together practitioners and researchers from both academia and industry in order to have a forum for discussion and technical presentations on latest theoretical and technological advances. https://lrsm.ibisc.univ-evry.fr/ADVANCE2013/

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In brief, the event objective is to gather Latin America (IEEE Region 09) and America´s accreditation agencies in order to discuss and foster mutual recognition agreements among them.
Beyond the enriching discussions, networking and best experience sharing among participants, the Summit will generate a ?Roadmap to Mutual Recognition Agreements in Latin America?, collecting participants most relevant contributions, experiences and recommendations towards a more effective and common accreditation process among countries.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PROGRAMA-DE-RADIO-OU-TV.TITULO: Innovation in Future Internet Scenario with Network Programmability and Smart Systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PROGRAMA-DE-RADIO-OU-TV.TITULO-INGLES: Innovation in Future Internet Scenario with Network Programmability and Smart Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Internet is always evolving and has a Strong presence in our Society. In parallel, ?Innovation? has become a decisive factor when creating, developing or researching new systems and applications. This talk points and discusses, with a simultaneous technical and strategic approach, how to aggregate innovation in the context of actual Internet evolution towards the Future Internet (FI). The adoption of OpenFlow/SDN with an autonomic approach is suggested as one possible way to innovate.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-RELATORIO-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO: D2.5 - Report on the deployment of the first version of the control and monitoring framework for the FIBRE-BR facilities
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-RELATORIO-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-INGLES: D2.5. Report on the deployment of the first version of the control and monitoring framework for the FIBRE-BR facilities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-RELATORIO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FIBRE - Future Internet testbeds/experimentation between BRazil and Europe

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This document starts by describing a holistic view of the FIBRE CMF combination, the addressing scheme, the identification through LDAP, and we further exemplify by giving a particular configuration of an island - the UFSCar island - to show how hardware and softwareb (available at the moment of this report) were organized and how it is being replicated in all other islands. We describe some preliminary tests and we also show the status of deployment of this new CMF software in all islands. In following sections, we discuss the features added to the CMFs, in order to cope with, the differences of the Brazilian testbed environment compared to other environments where the original CMFs (in isolation) were deployed in Europe and USA. In particular, we describe the modifications developed on the OFELIA control framework for the FIBRE-BR scenario. For example, one of the developments accomplished, was to make OCF installation and library dependencies more ?independent? of the underlying Linux distribution. For example, while the latest OCF framework makes substantial use of a specific Debian distro, on the other hand, netFPGA bitstreams have been using a more stable environment based on CentOS. Thus, it justifies the need to have OCF ported and compatible with a CentOs environment.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This document starts by describing a holistic view of the FIBRE CMF combination, the addressing scheme, the identification through LDAP, and we further exemplify by giving a particular configuration of an island - the UFSCar island - to show how hardware and softwareb (available at the moment of this report) were organized and how it is being replicated in all other islands. We describe some preliminary tests and we also show the status of deployment of this new CMF software in all islands. In following sections, we discuss the features added to the CMFs, in order to cope with, the differences of the Brazilian testbed environment compared to other environments where the original CMFs (in isolation) were deployed in Europe and USA. In particular, we describe the modifications developed on the OFELIA control framework for the FIBRE-BR scenario. For example, one of the developments accomplished, was to make OCF installation and library dependencies more ?independent? of the underlying Linux distribution. For example, while the latest OCF framework makes substantial use of a specific Debian distro, on the other hand, netFPGA bitstreams have been using a more stable environment based on CentOS. Thus, it justifies the need to have OCF ported and compatible with a CentOs environment.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-RELATORIO-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO: D2.6 - Report on the deployment of the second version of the control and monitoring framework for the FIBRE-BR facilities
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-RELATORIO-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-INGLES: D2.6 - Report on the deployment of the second version of the control and monitoring framework for the FIBRE-BR facilities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-RELATORIO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FIBRE - Future Internet testbeds/experimentation between BRazil and Europe

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The second version of the FIBRE CMF was reached at M34 (month) of the project as it is described here. There have been several major changes since the first version. As it can be verified in [Report 2.5], we described a more island centric view of the testbed, the major components and configuration and changes made to cope with Brazilian island peculiarities. While in this document, Deliverable 2.6 ? Second version of CMF, there are several steps that turn FIBRE-BR testbed more ready to deploy for a large audience of experimenters. The contributions on the second version of CMF are organized in the following subsections: in section 2, we describe the topology that interconnect all the BR islands, this was a major advancement, by using the FIBREnet overlay backbone on top of RNP backbone, and OpenFlow controllers to configure the paths, therefore, it enabled the individual islands to interoperate at full performance, without relying on VPN tunnels. In Section 3, we describe a major contribution on developing a truly multi-CMF authentication environment, this software allows CMFs (like OMF and OCF) to fully integrate and also combines the registry flexibility and readiness of LDAP servers (used in the earlier phases of this work), along with state of the art slice authentication standard based on GENI Slice Federation (SFA). Therefore, allowing the creation of a single-logon web portal to experimenters explained in Section 4. In terms of monitoring features, Section 5, focus on two dimensions: infrastructure and experiment monitoring. Each one of these dimensions have their particular challenge and these are addressed by several tools, like PerfSONAR performance servers and ZenOSS, customized to make available easily cross islands measurements. Finally, in Section 6, we presented some further modifications done on the CMFs that form the FIBRE-BR testbed, OCF and OMF. The modifications were done on some very specific issues related to BR LDAP authentication, robustness
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The second version of the FIBRE CMF was reached at M34 (month) of the project as it is described here. There have been several major changes since the first version. As it can be verified in [Report 2.5], we described a more island centric view of the testbed, the major components and configuration and changes made to cope with Brazilian island peculiarities. While in this document, Deliverable 2.6 ? Second version of CMF, there are several steps that turn FIBRE-BR testbed more ready to deploy for a large audience of experimenters. The contributions on the second version of CMF are organized in the following subsections: in section 2, we describe the topology that interconnect all the BR islands, this was a major advancement, by using the FIBREnet overlay backbone on top of RNP backbone, and OpenFlow controllers to configure the paths, therefore, it enabled the individual islands to interoperate at full performance, without relying on VPN tunnels. In Section 3, we describe a major contribution on developing a truly multi-CMF authentication environment, this software allows CMFs (like OMF and OCF) to fully integrate and also combines the registry flexibility and readiness of LDAP servers (used in the earlier phases of this work), along with state of the art slice authentication standard based on GENI Slice Federation (SFA). Therefore, allowing the creation of a single-logon web portal to experimenters explained in Section 4. In terms of monitoring features, Section 5, focus on two dimensions: infrastructure and experiment monitoring. Each one of these dimensions have their particular challenge and these are addressed by several tools, like PerfSONAR performance servers and ZenOSS, customized to make available easily cross islands measurements. Finally, in Section 6, we presented some further modifications done on the CMFs that form the FIBRE-BR testbed, OCF and OMF. The modifications were done on some very specific issues related to BR LDAP authentication, robustness

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper describes the CR-LDP protocol (Constraint-Route Label Distribution Protocol), which is used within MPLS networks in order to establish paths where constraints (such as available bandwith, peak rate) are taken into consideration. That allows support for QoS and Traffic Engineering into MPLS domains.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper describes the CR-LDP protocol (Constraint-Route Label Distribution Protocol), which is used within MPLS networks in order to establish paths where constraints (such as available bandwith, peak rate) are taken into consideration. That allows support for QoS and Traffic Engineering into MPLS domains.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Simpósio Brasileiro de Sistemas Multimídia e Web ? WebMedia é um evento anual promovido pela Sociedade Brasileira de Computação- SBC, que reúne pesquisadores e profissionais das áreas de Multimídia, Hipermídia e Web, para debates, palestras e minicursos. Realizado desde 1995, o evento tornou-se um dos principais eventos na área para a comunidade científica brasileira.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian Symposium on Multimedia and the Web - WebMedia, is supported by the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) and is the most important Brazilian forum for presentations, tutorials and discussions concerning recent advances in research and technology related to Multimedia, Hypermedia and the Web. WebMedia brings together professionals from both the academia and industry.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Simpósio Brasileiro de Redes de Computadores e Sistemas Distribuídos (SBRC) é um evento anual promovido pela Sociedade Brasileira de Computação (SBC) e pelo Laboratório Nacional de Redes de Computadores (LARC). Ao longo dos anos, o SBRC tornou-se o mais importante evento científico nacional em redes de computadores e sistemas distribuídos, e um dos mais concorridos em informática. A importância do SBRC pode ser observada pelo número de submissões de trabalhos e de participantes nas últimas edições, tendo sido classificado pela CAPES com o conceito A.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian Symposium on Computer Networks and Distributed Systems (SBRC) is an annual event promoted by the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) and by the Brazilian National Computer Networks Laboratory (LARC). Over the years, SBRC has become the most important Brazilian scientific event on computer networks and distributed systems, and one of the most demanding considering all fields of computer science. The impact of SBRC is endorsed by the number of submissions and by the number of attendees in the last editions. SBRC is nationally ranked grade A by CAPES, a Brazilian Government Agency for Research Support.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Simpósio Brasileiro de Redes de Computadores e Sistemas Distribuídos (SBRC) é um evento anual promovido pela Sociedade Brasileira de Computação (SBC) e pelo Laboratório Nacional de Redes de Computadores (LARC). Ao longo dos anos, o SBRC tornou-se o mais importante evento científico nacional em redes de computadores e sistemas distribuídos, e um dos mais concorridos em informática. A importância do SBRC pode ser observada pelo número de submissões de trabalhos e de participantes nas últimas edições, tendo sido classificado pela CAPES com o conceito A.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian Symposium on Computer Networks and Distributed Systems (SBRC) is an annual event promoted by the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) and by the Brazilian National Computer Networks Laboratory (LARC). Over the years, SBRC has become the most important Brazilian scientific event on computer networks and distributed systems, and one of the most demanding considering all fields of computer science. The impact of SBRC is endorsed by the number of submissions and by the number of attendees in the last editions. SBRC is nationally ranked grade A by CAPES, a Brazilian Government Agency for Research Support.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Simpósio Brasileiro de Sistemas Multimídia e Web ? WebMedia é um evento anual promovido pela Sociedade Brasileira de Computação- SBC, que reúne pesquisadores e profissionais das áreas de Multimídia, Hipermídia e Web, para debates, palestras e mini-cursos. Realizado desde 1995, o evento tornou-se um dos principais eventos na área para a comunidade científica brasileira.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian Symposium on Multimedia and the Web - WebMedia, is supported by the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) and is the most important Brazilian forum for presentations, tutorials and discussions concerning recent advances in research and technology related to Multimedia, Hypermedia and the Web. WebMedia brings together professionals from both the academia and industry.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The mission of the Global Learn conference is to further the advancement and innovation in learning and technology. As the educational world becomes increasingly global, new ways to explore, learn, and share knowledge are needed. Global Learn serves as a means to connect and engage creative educators, researchers, consultants, training managers, policy makers, curriculum developers, entrepreneurs, and others in the topics of distance learning and ICT technologies.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The mission of the Global Learn conference is to further the advancement and innovation in learning and technology. As the educational world becomes increasingly global, new ways to explore, learn, and share knowledge are needed. Global Learn serves as a means to connect and engage creative educators, researchers, consultants, training managers, policy makers, curriculum developers, entrepreneurs, and others in the topics of distance learning and ICT technologies.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O X Workshop de Teses e Dissertações (WTD 2010) do WebMedia 2010 é um fórum dedicado à apresentação e à discussão de trabalhos de mestrado e doutorado em andamento nas áreas de Multimídia, Hypermídia e Web. O principal objetivo do workshop é prover um forum onde alunos de mestrado e doutorado discutem sua pesquisa com membros experientes da comunidade atuante na área. Outro objetivo é promover integração e cooperação entre pesquisadores da academia e da indústria.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Brazilian Symposium on Computer Networks and Distributed Systems (SBRC) is an annual event promoted by the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) and by the National Computer Networks Laboratory (LARC). SBRC has become the most important scientific event on computer networks and distributed systems in Latin America. The large number of submitted papers and attendees in recent years attest its importance: the number of attendees per year varies from 800 to 1,200, and the paper acceptance rate is less than 30%, with over 300 submissions registered in each of the past few years.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian Symposium on Computer Networks and Distributed Systems (SBRC) is an annual event promoted by the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) and by the National Computer Networks Laboratory (LARC). SBRC has become the most important scientific event on computer networks and distributed systems in Latin America. The large number of submitted papers and attendees in recent years attest its importance: the number of attendees per year varies from 800 to 1,200, and the paper acceptance rate is less than 30%, with over 300 submissions registered in each of the past few years.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Advances in network and computing technologies are resulting in increasingly complex distributed systems and applications that are hard to manage, especially when the related services are required to be scalable, secure, and continuously available. This workshop aims at bringing together researchers and practitioners from the distributed systems community to discuss the fundamental principles, state of the art, and critical challenges of self-managing or autonomic distributed systems. The workshop not only focuses on distributed system models and algorithms, but also on the related software engineering aspects, tools, and technologies, that can be used to support self-managing behavior in distributed systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Advances in network and computing technologies are resulting in increasingly complex distributed systems and applications that are hard to manage, especially when the related services are required to be scalable, secure, and continuously available. This workshop aims at bringing together researchers and practitioners from the distributed systems community to discuss the fundamental principles, state of the art, and critical challenges of self-managing or autonomic distributed systems. The workshop not only focuses on distributed system models and algorithms, but also on the related software engineering aspects, tools, and technologies, that can be used to support self-managing behavior in distributed systems.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Software visualization (SoftVis) aims at using visual resources to represent software properties that can support users to uncover facts and relationships that otherwise would remain hidden.
Humans acquire more information through vision than all the other senses combined. For this reason, the design and use of visual resources play an important role in software engineering.
Despite the number of studies undertaken involving software visualization, this is the first event in Brazil that brings together researchers and representants from the industry to discuss on relevant results and challenges faced in the field. Special emphasis will be put on the knowledge transfer between academy and industry.
http://www.ppgcomp.unifacs.br/wbvissoft/home.html

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The 3rd IEEE ICCCT ,2012 is a major multidisciplinary conference organized with the objective of bringing together researchers ,developers, and practitioners from academia and industry working in all areas of computer and communication technology.It is being organised specifically to help computer industry to derive the advances of next generation computer and communiction technology.Researchers invited to speak ,will present the latest developments and technical solutions in the areas of Hardware & Software Design ,Distributed & Parallel Processing ,Advanced software Engineering,etc

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The mission of the Global Learn conference is to further the advancement and innovation in learning and technology. As the educational world becomes increasingly global, new ways to explore, learn, and share knowledge are needed. Global Learn serves as a means to connect and engage creative educators, researchers, consultants, training managers, policy makers, curriculum developers, entrepreneurs, and others in the topics of distance learning and ICT technologies.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The International Federation for Information Processing (IFIP) is a multi-national federation of professional and technical organizations, founded in 1960 under the auspices of UNESCO.
IFIP is dedicated to improving world-wide communication and increased understanding among practitioners of all nations about the role information processing, or informatics, can play in all walks of life.
Members of IFIP are national organizations in the field of information processing.
At the heart of IFIP activities are the Technical Committees (TC's).
Each Technical Committee has a particular focus; education is the focus of Technical Committee 3 (TC3).
Work within the focus of a Technical Committee is done in Working Groups (WG's) of specialists who are individually appointed by their peers, independent of nationality and of national governments.
IFIP Working Group 3.2 is such a Working Group concerned with informatics education at university level.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The International Federation for Information Processing (IFIP) is a multi-national federation of professional and technical organizations, founded in 1960 under the auspices of UNESCO.
IFIP is dedicated to improving world-wide communication and increased understanding among practitioners of all nations about the role information processing, or informatics, can play in all walks of life.
Members of IFIP are national organizations in the field of information processing.
At the heart of IFIP activities are the Technical Committees (TC's).
Each Technical Committee has a particular focus; education is the focus of Technical Committee 3 (TC3).
Work within the focus of a Technical Committee is done in Working Groups (WG's) of specialists who are individually appointed by their peers, independent of nationality and of national governments.
IFIP Working Group 3.2 is such a Working Group concerned with informatics education at university level.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Smart Grid Workshop focus primarily on the trends related to Smart Grid and gathers specialists from the electrical sector in Brazil in order to discuss current developments and future initiatives. The program will focus on discussing Smart Grid in terms of generation, distribution, management and involved costs and investments. This event is most likely to explore Brazilian and international issues and closes with an panel with representatives from most significant government and electrical companies and industry.

The program will focus on discussing Smart Grid in terms of generation, distribution, management and involved costs and investments. This event is most likely to explore Brazilian and international issues and closes with an panel with representatives from most significant government and electrical companies and industry.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: WSAN - Wireless Sensors and Actuators Networks

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: WSAN - Wireless Sensors and Actuators Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Due to the rapid development of embedded RF electronics and informatics, the availability of compact and very effective wireless systems is now an everyday reality. In order to meet the requirements of diverse applications, numerous technologies have been developed and standardized. WIFI, WIMAX, BLUETOOTH, ZIGBEE, RFID, UWB are some examples. Nowadays, there is very active research on new technologies and new applications worldwide, both at academic level and industrial side. The objective of this international meeting is to provide an open forum for Engineers, Scientists and Technologists to present new results and contributions and share new ideas associated with this very evolving field. The scope of the meeting includes a wide range of research challenges and new applications.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Due to the rapid development of embedded RF electronics and informatics, the availability of compact and very effective wireless systems is now an everyday reality. In order to meet the requirements of diverse applications, numerous technologies have been developed and standardized. WIFI, WIMAX, BLUETOOTH, ZIGBEE, RFID, UWB are some examples. Nowadays, there is very active research on new technologies and new applications worldwide, both at academic level and industrial side. The objective of this international meeting is to provide an open forum for Engineers, Scientists and Technologists to present new results and contributions and share new ideas associated with this very evolving field. The scope of the meeting includes a wide range of research challenges and new applications.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ICT technologies and new network infrastructures and services are changing drastically our society in all areas of applications. The advances in communication networks and computing infrastructure have not only an impact on the way people are working but also on the way they are interacting, learning, educating and so on. How these technologies do respond to the societal needs and how they should evolve to respond to future needs of the society are crucial aspects to discuss. After the successful organization of the ADVANCE workshop in 2012 in Canoa Quebrada (Brazil), and ADVANCE Workshop 2013 in Morro de Sao Paulo (Brazil), this 3rd edition that will be organised in Miami (USA) aims to sustain the effort of scientific collaborations bringing together practitioners and researchers from both academia and industry in order to have a forum for discussion and technical presentations on latest theoretical and technological advances.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ICT technologies and new network infrastructures and services are changing drastically our society in all areas of applications. The advances in communication networks and computing infrastructure have not only an impact on the way people are working but also on the way they are interacting, learning, educating and so on. How these technologies do respond to the societal needs and how they should evolve to respond to future needs of the society are crucial aspects to discuss. After the successful organization of the ADVANCE workshop in 2012 in Canoa Quebrada (Brazil), and ADVANCE Workshop 2013 in Morro de Sao Paulo (Brazil), this 3rd edition that will be organised in Miami (USA) aims to sustain the effort of scientific collaborations bringing together practitioners and researchers from both academia and industry in order to have a forum for discussion and technical presentations on latest theoretical and technological advances.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O IP&QoS atua com foco em internet do futuro, redes de próxima geração e monitoração.
Aspectos técnicos abordados incluem o OpenFlow e mecanismos de virtualização, mobilidade, qualidade de serviço, escalabilidade e a gerência autonômica de redes e sistemas. Tecnologias aplicadas incluem o OpenFlow, MPLS/GMPLS, redes de sensores, RFID, redes sem fio, redes ópticas e redes pessoais e residenciais (PAN/HAN) visando o desenvolvimento de aplicações e sistemas ubíquos e pervasivos.
Os aspectos de dimensionamento de redes visando o suporte de aplicações multimídia (VoIP, vídeo, TV Digital) e a computação ubíqua são igualmente um foco de P&D.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
O IP&QoS atua com foco em internet do futuro, redes de próxima geração e monitoração.

Tecnologias aplicadas incluem o OpenFlow, MPLS/GMPLS, redes de sensores, RFID, redes sem fio, redes ópticas e redes pessoais e residenciais (PAN/HAN) visando o desenvolvimento de aplicações e sistemas ubíquos e pervasivos.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO-TECNICA.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Universidade Salvador - UNIFACS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O NUPERC é um núcleo de pesquisa concebido para operar integrado ao Programa de Pós Graduação em Sistemas e Computação (PPGCOMP) da Universidade Salvador - UNIFACS. De forma a preservar essa relação sinergética, uma parte das pesquisas desenvolvidas têm um aspecto pragmático, orientadas a soluções de problemas ou geração de ideias conectadas à realidade de curto e médio prazos de empresas de tecnologia regionais e nacionais. Entretanto, grande parte dos pesquisadores possui extensa formação científica, tornando também natural o foco do núcleo em pesquisas que explorem o estado da arte dos temas a que se dedica. O NUPERC tem realizado pesquisas de importância para empresas, e para a comunidade científica nacional e internacional, relacionadas principalmente com: a avaliação de desempenho de soluções de redes de alta velocidade; o estudo e avaliação de mecanismos para garantia de QoS (Qualidade de Serviço) em aplicações multimídia sob redes móveis ou não; o estudo das redes ópticas, o controle de tráfego e congestionamento em redes de alta velocidade; o desenvolvimento de novas tecnologias e aplicações para a Internet e Web; a mineração de grande quantidade de dados, como os disponíveis pela Internet; e o desenvolvimento de técnicas e metodologias em engenharia de software e aplicações sobre a Internet. O NUPERC destaca-se ainda como um dos grupos de pesquisa em redes e compmutação mais capacitados e atuantes na Bahia, com potencial para coordenar ações em diversos segmentos da área de computação e contribuir com o desenvolvimento social e econômico da região. Os trabalhos do NUPERC alcançam seu público alvo através de meios diversos, como o desenvolvimento de projetos de P&D, a realização de consultorias, a divulgação de resultados em eventos e periódicos, a realização de cursos de extensão, a participação de seus pesquisadores em cursos regulares de graduação e pós-graduação da UNIFACS.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: WSAN - Wireless Sensors and Actuators Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O GROW atua em diversos aspectos da pesquisa em tecnologias ópticas, tais como: - alocação de recursos para redes ópticas elásticas (EON - Optical Elastic Networks) - Especificação de arquiteturas e protocolos para redes ópticas. - Desenvolvimento de estudos e ferramentas para projeto e otimização de redes ópticas: ferramentas de simulação SimRWA, OB2S e TONets. - Estudos sobre clusterização em redes de sensores sem fio.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: O GROW atua em diversos aspectos da pesquisa em tecnologias ópticas, tais como: - alocação de recursos para redes ópticas elásticas (EON - Optical Elastic Networks) - Especificação de arquiteturas e protocolos para redes ópticas. - Desenvolvimento de estudos e ferramentas para projeto e otimização de redes ópticas: ferramentas de simulação SimRWA, OB2S e TONets. - Estudos sobre clusterização em redes de sensores sem fio.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The International Federation for Information Processing (IFIP) is a multi-national federation of professional and technical organizations, founded in 1960 under the auspices of UNESCO.
IFIP is dedicated to improving world-wide communication and increased understanding among practitioners of all nations about the role information processing, or informatics, can play in all walks of life.
Members of IFIP are national organizations in the field of information processing.
At the heart of IFIP activities are the Technical Committees (TC's).
Each Technical Committee has a particular focus; education is the focus of Technical Committee 3 (TC3).
Work within the focus of a Technical Committee is done in Working Groups (WG's) of specialists who are individually appointed by their peers, independent of nationality and of national governments.
IFIP Working Group 3.2 is such a Working Group concerned with informatics education at university level.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

Members of IFIP are national organizations in the field of information processing.
At the heart of IFIP activities are the Technical Committees (TC's).
Each Technical Committee has a particular focus; education is the focus of Technical Committee 3 (TC3).
Work within the focus of a Technical Committee is done in Working Groups (WG's) of specialists who are individually appointed by their peers, independent of nationality and of national governments.
IFIP Working Group 3.2 is such a Working Group concerned with informatics education at university level.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The International Federation for Information Processing (IFIP) is a multi-national federation of professional and technical organizations, founded in 1960 under the auspices of UNESCO.
IFIP is dedicated to improving world-wide communication and increased understanding among practitioners of all nations about the role information processing, or informatics, can play in all walks of life.
Members of IFIP are national organizations in the field of information processing.
At the heart of IFIP activities are the Technical Committees (TC's).
Each Technical Committee has a particular focus; education is the focus of Technical Committee 3 (TC3).
Work within the focus of a Technical Committee is done in Working Groups (WG's) of specialists who are individually appointed by their peers, independent of nationality and of national governments.
IFIP Working Group 3.2 is such a Working Group concerned with informatics education at university level.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The FIBRE Project ended in October 2014 (co-funded by the Brazilian government and the EU?s Seventh Framework Programme ? FP7).
In 2015 the Brazilian institutions took over FIBRE?s legacy infrastructure to start offering the testbed as a service. With the end of the EU-BR project, a new governance model, admission rules, policies, and service operation processes had to be defined.
Each institution providing resources to the testbed (i.e., hosting an experimental island) has one appointed person who is responsible for authorization and administrative issues related to FIBRE within its institution. This person also has a seat in the FIBRE?s Steering Committee, which is the ultimate governance board of the FIBRE testbed.
https://fibre.org.br/about/governance-model/

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO-TECNICA.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: RNP - Rede Nacional de Pesquisa

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The FIBRE testbed is as research facility constructed in the scope of a former project funded by the 2010 Brazil-EU Coordinated Call in ICT.
It works as a large-scale Virtual Laboratory for students and researchers to test new applications and network architecture models.
Currently, the FIBRE infrastructure consists of a federation of 11 local testbeds, also called ?experimentation nodes? or simply ?islands?.
Each ?island? have a set of network devices to support experiments in both fixed and wireless technologies. They are connected by an overlay network on the RNP backbone, comprised of two network separate layers: a control plane and an experiment plane. This network is named ?FIBREnet?.
The governance model allows each participating institution to have autonomy over their local resources, while they may use resources from other islands to setup network experiments.
It is not necessary to host an experimental island to use the testbed. FIBRE is open to use by any researcher, professor or student from any institution.
FIBRE objectives:
Build a Future Internet testbed in Brazil, federated with other worldwide testbed initiatives. Provide a large scale platform for promoting the Future Internet research in Brazil and region. Encourage educators to use the testbed for network classes to foster a new generation of researchers.
